item.title: Error-Based SQL Injection
item.description:
Error-Based SQL Injection (SQLi)

Error-Based SQL Injection is a type of SQL injection where attackers exploit database errors to extract information from a web application. Unlike other SQL injection techniques, Error-Based SQLi relies on the database returning detailed error messages that reveal sensitive information such as table names, column names, or database structure.

Why Error-Based SQL Injection Happens

Error-Based SQL Injection occurs when:

  • User inputs are directly included in SQL queries without proper validation or sanitization.
  • The database or application displays detailed error messages to the user.
  • Developers do not use parameterized queries or stored procedures.
